prompt:
Original Request:
make a calculator

Additional Details from User:
Q: What platform(s) do you envision this calculator running on (e.g., web browser, desktop application, mobile app for iOS/Android, command-line tool), and do you have any preferred programming languages or frameworks?
A: python
Q: What specific types of calculations should it support (e.g., basic arithmetic, scientific functions, unit conversions, financial), and are there any advanced features like memory, history, or graphing?
A: basic
Q: What level of precision is required for calculations, and how should error conditions (e.g., division by zero, invalid input) be handled?
A: basic
Q: Do you have any specific design preferences for the user interface (e.g., layout, color scheme, responsiveness), or should it be a command-line interface?
A: dark mode
Q: How will this calculator be deployed or distributed to users (e.g., downloadable application, web link, app store), and does it need to integrate with any other systems or data sources?
A: standalone app

Please build a project that incorporates all of the above requirements and preferences.

srs.description: A standalone calculator application developed in Python, designed to perform basic arithmetic operations. It will feature a dark mode user interface and handle common error conditions.
functional_requirements: Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Accept numerical input from the user.
Handle division by zero errors gracefully.
Handle invalid input (non-numeric characters, improper formatting) gracefully.
Provide a user interface for input and display.
non_functional_requirements: The user interface shall implement a dark mode theme.
The application shall be deployable as a standalone executable.
The application shall be robust against common input errors.
The application shall be easy to use for basic arithmetic functions.
constraints: The calculator must be a standalone application.
Only basic arithmetic operations are required.
The user interface must support dark mode.
